title: YAS! Fest: Youth Arts Showcase
description:
As part of the citywide Year of Creative Youth festival, experience a showcase of youth performances and artworks connected to exhibitions and made by youth from partner organizations PROjectUS; Shine On, Chicago!; Street Level Youth Media; and Young Chicago Authors.

Program:

GRIFFIN COURT

Street Level Youth Media Live Podcast

Drop in 11:00–3:00

 Join Street Level Youth Media for a live podcast interview with Chicago teens about their neighborhoods.

PROjectUS Photo Booth

Drop in 11:00–3:00

Strike a pose and capture the moment.

Make It Stick

Drop in 11:00–3:00 

Join the School of the Art Institute’s Youth and Family Outreach program to create your own stickers and buttons.

Don’t forget to check out the Teen Audio Guide and explore the museum immersed in the stories and sounds of Chicago youth.

Look out for the fashion parade led by PROjectUS, starting at 2:30 in Griffin Court! The parade ends in Millennium Park.

RYAN LEARNING CENTER

Say What?!

Drop in 11:00–3:00,  Studio B

 Work with SkyART Project 3rd Space teens to leave messages, ask questions, and speak your truth—all in a coded alphabet.

Young Chicago Authors Performance + Open Mic

Drop in 12:30–2:00,  Studio A

 Come support YCA teens in a spoken word performance followed by an open mic. Sign up to perform at the check-in table.

Teen Photography Exhibit

Drop in 11:00–3:00,  Classroom 3 and Studio B 

Check out amazing photographs created and curated by teens from Shine On, Chicago! and PROjectUS.

PROjectUS Art Installation: Neeyah Muhammad

Drop in 11:00–3:00, Classroom 4

Animation Screening

Drop in 11:00–3:00 , Classroom 3 

Join us for a showcase of youth animation work created by students in School of the Art Institute of Chicago at Homan Square courses and open studios.

Good Vibes Only!

11:00–3:00,  Classroom 5 

Grab a snack, listen to some tunes, and meet Art Institute teens in our teen hang space.

Persons with disabilities who would like to request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program are encouraged to send an e-mail to access@artic.edu as far in advance as possible.

Please see the museum’s Accessibility page for more information.
